entry.title: The Phoenix Project
entry.content:
Show Date: Monday, March 25, 2013

In this episode, we sat down with Gene Kim and Jez Humble to discuss The Phoenix Project: A Novel About IT, DevOps, and Helping Your Business Win.

  • Panel
  • Chef News
  • Outline
  • Reading List
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video Stream

Watch Now

In the News

  • foodcritic 2.0.0 - CHANGELOG
  • jvmargs - Sanity check command-line arguments to the JVM. github
  • minitest-handler cookbook
  • Cookbook Versioning Policy - Sane versioning for Chef Cookbooks

Outline

  • Introductions
  • Intro to the Phoenix Project
  • Phoenix Project - Why now?
  • Definition of DevOps - 13:02
  • The Three Ways - 14:40
    • Apply Systems Thinking
    • Create and Amplify Feedback Loops
    • Create a Culture of Continuous Experimentation and Learning
  • Visibility of IT Operations - 23:00
  • Story format - 54:30

Other Resources

  • Where To Learn More About Concepts In "The Phoenix Project"
  • The Construction Of “The Phoenix Project:” Using The Downward Spiral To Better Sell DevOps
  • Defensive DevOps Audit Kit
  • Etsy’s Product Development with Continuous Experimentation
  • Continuous Delivery and ITIL: Change Management
  • PCI-DSS and continuous deployment at Etsy
  • GitHub ElasticSearch Incident Review

Books Mentioned in the Show

  • 5 Dysfunctions Of A Team
  • Toyota Kata
  • Kanban: Successful Evolutionary Change for Your Technology Business
  • Continuous Delivery
  • Release It!: Design and Deploy Production-Ready Software
  • Lean UX: Applying Lean Principles to Improve User Experience
